intro: Tournefortia asperrima, commonly known as the rough tournefortia, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges.
